law.text:
A license to operate a nudist society may be revoked by order of the county judge/executive at any time, following a hearing upon reasonable notice to the licensee and a finding by the county judge/executive that:
The activities of the nudist society are not being effectively concealed from the ordinary view of the public, or
The activities of the nudist society are not sufficiently isolated from the public, or sufficient precautions are not being taken to exclude the presence of nonmembers, or
The nudist society is not being operated in accordance with the purpose for which it was licensed, or
The owner or operator has been convicted of a felony, or a misdemeanor involving disorder or breach of the peace arising out of the operation of the nudist society.
law.history: Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 372, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 203, sec. 3.
